job description:
More Information about this Job

American Medical Response

Washington DC

Data Analyst

Job Title: Analyst, Operations Planning & Analytics

Reports To: Communications Center Director

FLSA Status: Exempt

Position Summary:

This position is responsible for all phases of operational performance analysis, including but not limited to the creation of business rules, measure development, data collection, report design, summarization and validation.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Analyze operational data reports for select business units to assure data integrity, adherence to proper dispatch process, operational performance metrics and accuracy.
  • Work closely with both communications/dispatch leadership and operations leadership to address performance improvement opportunities identified by Comm. Center operator, down to the keystroke input level.
  • Lead efforts to assure timely resolution of late call analysis by individual business units.
  • Produce timely partner performance reports per contract terms.
  • Perform complex, multilayered analysis of operational performance utilizing data from multiple sources.
  • Assist leaders by assembling data to support internal performance presentations.
  • Assist leadership in the development and evaluation of key metrics and benchmarks.
  • Create operational performance reports and test for accuracy on a regular basis.
  • Seek new and innovative ways for AMR to provide great service at a higher level of efficiency to its patients and customers.
  • Document and share leading practices in deployment planning and educate operations management by disseminating knowledge of Central Planning tools and processes.
  • Adhere to all company policies and procedures.
  • Adherence to and compliance with information systems security is everyone's responsibility. It is the responsibility of every computer user to: Know and follow Information Systems security policies and procedures. Attend Information Systems security training, when offered. Report information systems security problems.
  • Ability to use / operate standard office equipment and tools.
Non-Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications:

Education/Licensing/Certification:
  • Bachelor's degree in business, mathematics, statistics, operations research, engineering, or computer science is preferred.
  • Experience:
    •
  • 3 or more years of relevant experience in a role requiring independent analysis of performance metrics.
  • Prefer experience in high volume call center, healthcare and/or EMS.
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Proven analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to interpret, analyze and track complicated contract requirements. Offering guidance to leadership on how best to improve performance.
  • Proficient in spreadsheet, reporting and database tools (e.g., Excel, Access, other Microsoft Office applications).
  • Excellent communication skills (written and oral) with various levels within the organization.
  • Must be a self-starter with the ability to develop analysis of clinical performance data with limited supervision.
  • Ability to work with others in a high volume fast paced environment as well as ability to work independently with little direct interaction with other employees.
EEO Statement

EOE including Veterans and Disabled
